title: Dominant Service Sector Employment
description: In 2023, Djibouti had a remarkable 92.86% of its total employment in the service sector, with 98.44% of female and 90.93% of male employment in services. This highlights a strong reliance on the service industry for job creation.

title: High Youth Unemployment Rates
description: As of 2024, Djibouti faces significant challenges with youth unemployment, with 76.32% of the total youth labor force unemployed. Female youth unemployment is at 77.86%, and male youth unemployment is at 75.27%.

title: Booming Export Growth
description: In 2021, Djibouti's export volume index reached 1926.42, and the export value index soared to 2455.37, indicating a significant increase in export activities since 2015.

title: Dependence on Transport Services Imports
description: Transport services accounted for 87.07% of Djibouti's service imports in 2023, reflecting a heavy reliance on transportation for its import activities.

title: Significant Manufacturing Growth
description: Djibouti experienced a substantial 23.13% growth in manufacturing value added in 2021, showcasing a rapidly expanding manufacturing sector.

title: High Import Activity
description: In 2021, Djibouti's import volume index was 370.44, and the import value index was 460.72, indicating a robust import market since 2015.

title: Youth Unemployment with Basic Education
description: In 2017, 53.32% of Djibouti's female labor force with basic education was unemployed, highlighting challenges in job opportunities for educated youth.

title: Low Government Investment in Secondary Education
description: In 2016, Djibouti's government expenditure per student in secondary education was only 0.73% of GDP per capita, indicating minimal investment in this sector.

title: Minimal Focus on Secondary Education
description: Djibouti allocated just 0.83% of its total government expenditure on education to secondary education in 2016, highlighting a lack of emphasis on this educational stage.

title: Low Impact of Health Expenditure on Poverty
description: In 2017, only 0.1% of Djibouti's population was pushed below the 60% median consumption poverty line due to out-of-pocket health expenses, showcasing a minimal impact.

title: Low Female Youth Employment Rate
description: The employment to population ratio for females aged 15-24 in Djibouti was just 2.47% in 2024, indicating limited job opportunities for young women.

title: Limited Male Youth Employment Opportunities
description: In 2017, the employment to population ratio for males aged 15-24 was 5.01%, reflecting restricted employment prospects for young men in Djibouti.

title: Overall Low Youth Employment
description: The total employment to population ratio for ages 15-24 in Djibouti was 3.99% in 2017, indicating a challenging job market for the youth.

title: Low Youth Labor Force Participation
description: In 2024, Djibouti's labor force participation rate for ages 15-24 was 13.62%, suggesting limited engagement of the youth in the labor market.

title: Negative Merchandise Import Residual
description: In 2022, Djibouti's merchandise imports by the reporting economy showed a residual of -2.05e-13% of total merchandise imports, indicating discrepancies in trade data.
